attributes.action: Reduce the huge amount of fuel duty/tax on petrol and diesel.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Petrol costs about 0.85p per litre at the moment and out of that, roughly 0.35p of that is the actual cost of the fuel itself.  The tax and VAT alone costs more than the product itself at about 0.50p per litre.
In a typical £25 fill up, the fuel only costs roughly £10.32, the rest is purely tax.

We all have to get to work some how, especially in rural area's where public transport is practially non existant and the rate of tax on fuel is simply unacceptable when the money is spent on anything but finding alternative fuels, improving roads or sorting out the public transport nightmare.

Fuel duty should be reduced to a more acceptable level and investment made into alternative fuels, making road systems more efficient and improving public transport.
